Key Match Events: Jalen Suggs suffered a back injury during the game against the Toronto Raptors, which required him to be taken off the court in a wheelchair.
Despite Suggs' injury, the Orlando Magic won the game with a final score of 106-97.
Post-Match Reflections: Magic head coach Jamahl Mosley provided an update after the game, revealing that Suggs was dealing with back spasms and that the team would assess his condition further the following day.
The Magic's victory places them in fourth place in the Eastern Conference with a record of 21-15.
Others: Jalen Suggs has been having a career-best season with an average of 16.8 points per game, 4.2 rebounds, and nearly 30 minutes of play per game.
Suggs earned second-team NBA All-Defense honors last year.
